intro: Cynanchum glaberrimum, commonly known as the smooth milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces a milky sap, which is typical of many species in its family. Its leaves are alternate and often have a hairy texture, while its roots are deep and fibrous. Cynanchum glaberrimum is adapted to survive in harsh environments, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
